items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex edges up 111 pts, Nifty holds above 26,215 as D-St closes just shy of record highs
items.summary: Indian equities reached new all-time highs on Thursday, with both the Sensex and Nifty briefly touching record levels before closing with modest gains. Investor optimism, fueled by expectations of potential U.S. and domestic interest-rate cuts next month, supported a positive market sentiment and attracted fresh buying.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 end flat after hitting record highs— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
items.summary: The Sensex closed 111 points, or 0.13%, higher at 85,720.38. The Nifty 50 closed at 26,215.55, up 10 points, or 0.04 per cent. The mid and small-cap segments underperformed. The BSE Midcap index closed flat, while the Smallcap index closed 0.38% lower.

items.title: Kaushalya Logistics appoints Rajendra Singh Shekhawat as Chief Executive Officer
items.summary: With over 24 years of experience in the cement and logistics industry, Shekhawat's career spans senior positions across top cement manufacturers

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Nov 27: Ashok Leyland, Ather Energy, Bajaj Finance, Emami, Tejas Networks among top gainers
items.summary: After hitting record highs, the Indian stock market saw a pullback, with the Nifty 50 and Sensex closing with small gains. Positive investor sentiment remained amid expectations of a US Fed rate cut, while sectors like media and banking rallied, contrasting losses in realty.

items.title: China’s Anta Sports explores potential takeover of Puma
items.summary: Talks remain preliminary as bidders assess valuation hurdles posed by major shareholder Pinault family’s expectations; Puma shares jump 11% on Germany’s Tradegate exchange

items.title: Individual NBP in life insurance may grow 9% in FY26: ICRA
items.summary: NBP for life insurance sector expected to grow to ₹1.8 lakh crore in FY26

items.title: Paint makers bet on strong markets, not big discounts, as competition intensifies
items.summary: India's paints market is seeing intense competition, forcing companies to move beyond aggressive discounting.

items.title: Income Tax dept to send SMS/emails to 25,000 individuals for non-disclosure of foreign assets
items.summary: The Income Tax department has identified individuals who have not reported foreign assets in their income tax returns. These taxpayers will receive SMS and emails starting November 28. They are advised to file a revised ITR by December 31, 2025. This action aims to ensure accurate reporting of foreign assets and income. Failure to comply may lead to penal consequences.

items.title: Economy likely to have grown between 7-7.5% during Q2 of FY26, suggest reports
items.summary: ICRA has projected the year-on-year GDP expansion to ease to 7.0% in Q2 from 7.8% in Q1

items.title: Can India become self-reliant in REE production?
items.summary: China is tightening the screws on supply of rare earth minerals. Can India build alternatives and secure its critical mineral needs?

items.title: Equirus Group appoints Manish Jain as CEO of Equirus Finance to lead its NBFC operations
items.summary: Equirus Group has appointed Manishkumar Jain as the Chief Executive Officer of its new non-deposit-taking NBFC, Equirus Finance. This strategic move follows the Reserve Bank of India's approval for the NBFC. Jain will lead the development of a diversified lending franchise. Equirus Finance will offer bespoke funding solutions to high net-worth individuals and family offices.

items.title: Puma stock surges 17% as China's Anta Sports looks to acquire firm. Details here
items.summary: Puma stock price jumped more than 17% during the intraday trading session on 27 November 2025, after a market buzz on a potential takeover by Chinese giant Anta Sports Products. The company is in talks with a financial advisor for a bid on the German shoemaker.&nbsp;

items.title: Q2 GDP blockbuster or slow burn? India braces for Friday show
items.summary: India Q2 GDP: India's Gross Domestic Product numbers for the second quarter are set to be released on Friday. Expectations are high for a robust growth figure, possibly surpassing the Reserve Bank of India's projection. This strong performance is anticipated to maintain India's position as a leading global economic growth engine. Several factors are contributing to this positive outlook.

items.title: US-based Tesla wins as HC grants interim injunction, bars Indian firm from using trademark
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has issued an interim order. US-based Tesla Inc received this injunction against Indian company Tesla Power India. Tesla Power India is now prohibited from using 'Tesla Power' or 'Tesla Power USA' trademarks. This includes manufacturing electric vehicles. The court noted the Indian company's statement of no intention to produce EVs.

items.title: Multibagger SME IPOs 2025: These five issues rise up to 400% against issue price
items.summary: In 2025, several SME IPOs like Cryogenic Ogs and Tankup Engineers yielded impressive returns exceeding 300-400%, while 23 others rose between 100-200%. However, analysts worry about high valuations and lack of understanding among investors, indicating a communication failure by promoters.

items.title: India Q2 GDP preview: Urban demand, rural spending amid favourable base likely pushed growth to 7–8%
items.summary: Economists predict India's Q2FY26 GDP growth could reach 7-8%, driven by strong government spending, urban demand, and a revival in rural spending, amid a favourable base. With the key data set for release, the economic landscape appears promising yet cautious.

items.title: Sudeep Pharma IPO listing date tomorrow. Here’s what GMP signals about the share debut on Dalal Street
items.summary: Sudeep Pharma IPO listing date is November 28, and the equity shares will be listed on BSE and NSE. Ahead of the share debut, Sudeep Pharma IPO GMP today signals a strong debut of shares on Dalal Street.

items.title: Top 10 Nifty stocks that are down up to 94% from record peaks. How many do you have?
FIIs, mutual funds slash stake in Suzlon Energy; stock down 12% in 2025 so far
items.summary: Suzlon Energy delivered a strong quarter with improved margins, efficient execution, and solid profitability despite institutional investors reducing exposure. While fundamentals continue to strengthen, technical indicators show short-term weakness. Analyst sentiment remains broadly positive, suggesting potential upside as the company advances its turnaround within India’s expanding clean-energy landscape

items.title: ₹1.50 to  ₹1410: Multibagger penny stock turns  ₹1 lakh into  ₹9.40 crore in five years
items.summary: On Thursday, the multibagger penny stock was trading 1.19% up at  ₹1,410 amid strong market sentiments. The penny stock opened at  ₹1,392 on NSE in early morning session on Thursday, however, it touched an intraday high of  ₹1,423 during the session.

items.title: Organized sector to drive India's food services market 60% higher by 2030: report
items.summary: The organized sector—led by cloud kitchens, quick-service restaurants (QSRs) and café chains—is expected to double and overtake the unorganized sector by the end of the decade, expanding at a 12-14% CAGR compared to 5-7% for unorganized players.

items.title: What happens if China weaponizes its global dominance of pharmaceutical ingredients?
items.summary: The US may have paused its trade war with China, but Beijing still holds a powerful lever: control over the inputs that go into essential medicines. As Washington mulls its options, could India become a critical partner for pharma resilience?

items.title: J-10 fighter jet maker AVIC Chengdu stock falls 5% in November despite Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions: How to trade?
items.summary: AVIC Chengdu's stock is seeing a pullback following a sharp run-up in the earlier part of 2025 as the J-10 was used in a recent conflict between Pakistan — China's close defence partner — and India.

items.title: Think tank says 30 false-flag tankers shipped €2.1 billion worth of Russian oil to India in 2025
items.summary: The shipments formed the single largest national destination for crude moved by Russia's expanding "shadow fleet", according to the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air

items.title: XEV 9S: Mahindra introduces 7-seater electric SUV starting at ₹19.95 lakh
items.summary: To cater to the growing demand of its Electric Origin vehicles, the company has decided to increase production capacity from 4,500 units a month to 8,000 units from April 2026

items.title: Maple Infrastructure Trust completes acquisition of 5 toll road highway assets from ACL
items.summary: Following the acquisition, Maple's portfolio will increase from two existing assets with a combined length of 1,212 lane kilometres to seven assets with a combined length of 3,328 lane kilometres, representing a jump of over 1.7 times, a statement said.

items.title: Think tank says 30 false-flag tankers shipped EUR 2.1 bn Russian oil to India in 2025
items.summary: India received 5.4 million tonnes of Russian crude worth €2.1 billion between January and September 2025 on 30 tankers sailing under false flags, according to a report by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air.

items.title: Magellanic Cloud shares crash 10%, extending 4-day rout to 46%. What’s triggering the plunge?
items.summary: Magellanic Cloud’s shares hit a 10% lower circuit on November 27, dragging the stock down more than 46% in just four trading sessions, despite the company announcing a Rs 6 crore order win from East Coast Railway earlier in the week. The stock has now dropped around 68% from its July high and is down 55% in 2025 so far.

items.title: Anita Kotwani steps down from Dentsu after five years
items.summary: Anita Kotwani has left Dentsu South Asia after five years as Chief Client Officer. She is moving on to new career ventures. During her tenure, Dentsu India's Media practice saw significant growth and new brand wins. Kotwani expressed pride in her achievements and the teams she worked with. Dentsu has begun a transition plan to ensure client continuity.

items.title: Apple single-handedly drives Singles' Day smartphone sales growth in China
items.summary: On Singles' Day, Apple's iPhone sales soared, single-handedly propelling smartphone sales in China to heights. The tech powerhouse secured a considerable share of the market, while the overall sector faltered, revealing a cautious outlook among consumers nationwide.

items.title: Tourism could rise up to threefold during 2030 Commonwealth games: Gulam Zia
items.summary: Ahmedabad gears up for the 2030 Commonwealth Games with a massive infrastructure push.  Expect significant upgrades to metro, BRT, and roads, alongside a substantial boost in sports facilities costing an estimated ₹20,000 crore.  The city faces a huge hospitality challenge, needing 50,000 rooms, and anticipates a surge in real estate values and tourism.

items.title: Government to push green fuel farm equipment, boost access for small farmers: Agri Secy
items.summary: "Over the next 5-10 years, we should shift our technologies towards green fuels -- whether electrically operated tractors or machines running on CBG available from rural CBG plants," Agri Secy said

items.title: Nifty Infra delivers double the Nifty 50 returns over 3 years. Here are key sectors to watch in India’s multi-year capex boom
items.summary: The Nifty Infrastructure Index has outperformed the Nifty 50 by a wide margin, delivering 2x its three-year returns as India enters a multi-year capex boom. Investment managers highlight strong order books, improving execution, and sectoral tailwinds across roads, airports, logistics, energy, and digital infrastructure through FY26–FY30.

items.title: Narrow rally, tough portfolios: Devina Mehra explains why Nifty highs don’t reflect market reality
items.summary: The Nifty is near record highs, but Devina Mehra warns the broader market remains weak, with nearly half of stocks still 20% below their peaks. In an interview, she explains why the rally is narrow, why PSU banks still offer value, and why FMCG, pharma and autos remain strong bets as investors await a broader market recovery.

items.title: A bold new dawn for India’s workforce: Labour codes that deserve applause -- and swift, unified implementation
items.summary: India new labour code: The government has corrected a long-standing imbalance. The new structure is bold, ambitious and timely. More importantly, it lays the groundwork for a fairer, more competitive, and more future-ready India.

items.title: Indian Rum Camikara wins Global Brand of the Year award
items.summary: The rum is distilled from fresh sugarcane juice and aged in American oak barrels under North India’s climate. It is available in three expressions: 3-year, 8-year, and 12-year aged variants

items.title: Mahindra plans steep EV ramp-up; eyes 7,000 monthly sales by fiscal-end
items.summary: Mahindra is boosting its electric vehicle production to 8,000 units monthly, aiming to sell 7,000 by fiscal year-end. EVs are projected to form a quarter of total sales by 2027-28. The company is expanding its charging network and exploring battery recycling. New electric SUVs are being introduced, with plans for exports to right-hand drive markets first.

items.title: Monthly economic review: GST rate cut boosts consumption; economy to maintain growth momentum
items.summary: The Finance Ministry’s Monthly Economic Review for October said that with inflationary pressures easing and recent tax reforms boosting household disposable incomes, the near-term consumption outlook appears increasingly positive

items.title: Nvidia gets vocal as rivals close the gap. That isn’t always a good sign.
items.summary: The chip maker is still in the lead, but it may soon have company.

items.title: GST hit slows FMCG in Q2, but rural India readies a fightback
items.summary: India's FMCG sector experienced a slight growth moderation in Q2 FY26 due to revised GST rates, but industry players anticipate a strong revival in the latter half. Rural demand continues to outperform urban, with expectations of consumption catalysts from GST rate cuts and favorable monsoons driving recovery.

items.title: Nifty hits record high, but half its stocks haven’t in 2025. What’s next for investors?
items.summary: Nifty reclaimed a fresh record high after 14 months, ending a long corrective phase driven by expensive valuations, heavy FII outflows, geopolitical risks, and soft earnings. Despite the milestone, foreign investors still remain significantly under-exposed to India, with their holdings at a 15-year low following over ₹2 lakh crore in selling this year.

items.title: Residential realty bookings growth remains strong, collection efficiency falls
items.summary: India's housing market is set for strong growth. Bookings by value are expected to rise 10-12% in FY25-26. Demand for premium and luxury homes is driving this expansion. While affordable housing may see slower growth, the overall market remains robust. Developers are seeing increased sales volumes and higher prices.

items.title: Mt K Kapital raises over Rs 4,000 cr through India credit fund
items.summary: Mt K Kapital is raising over Rs 4,000 crore for its second fund, targeting domestic and offshore investors. The partnership-driven platform will invest in residential, mixed-use, and redevelopment projects across key Indian markets, focusing on early-stage acquisition and pre-approval stages. This capital raise supports the expansion of its strategy, building on the success of its first fund.

items.title: KKR-backed Serentica may raise up to $8 billion for India green energy expansion
items.summary: The first phase of the planned investment, about $3 billion, is fully funded and the next phase, $2 billion, is partly funded, with the rest under discussion, says Serentica Renewables’ Chairman

items.title: Housing sales in India’s top 15 tier 2 cities fell 4% YoY
items.summary: Housing sales in India's top 15 tier 2 cities saw a 4% year-on-year decline in the third quarter of 2025. Despite fewer units sold, the total sales value increased by 4%, suggesting a move towards more premium properties. New housing launches also dropped by 10%. Ahmedabad remained the leading market for both sales and new launches.

items.title: Vaishno Devi medical college's proposal to shift MBBS seats to all-India quota rejected
items.summary: The National Medical Commission has rejected a proposal from Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence to place all its 50 MBBS seats under the All-India Quota. The decision was made as it goes against existing policy and requires broader consultation with all states and stakeholders.

items.title: India’s merchandise exports aren’t too exposed to the US—we need to watch out for services
items.summary: In the face of Trump’s ever-shifting policies, India’s real vulnerability isn’t merchandise shipments, but service exports. We need to double down on diversifying these even as we pursue a trade deal with Washington.

items.title: Bitcoin rebounds to $91,000. Can it rally further amid US Fed rate cut buzz?
items.summary: Ethereum surged 3.75% over the last 24 hours, pushing its price above $3,000. Several major altcoins — including XRP, BNB, Solana, Tron, Dogecoin, Cardano, and Hyperliquid — also recorded gains of more than 4% during the same period.

items.title: Stock market holiday: US stock market to remain closed today due to Thanksgiving Day
items.summary: Stock market holiday: According to the stock market holiday list on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the US stock market will remain closed on Thursday, 27 November 2025, on the account of Thanksgiving holiday.

items.title: WOL3D appoints CA Mayuresh Advilkar as Chief Financial Officer
items.summary: Advilkar, a qualified Chartered Accountant, has over a decade of experience in financial reporting, budgeting, taxation, audits, and regulatory management

items.title: Investments in renewable energy sector likely to hit record high in 2025
items.summary: The nine-month (January-September) investment numbers in 2025 already reached $17.96 billion, well above the full-year numbers in 2022 ($15.2 billion), 2023 ($13.2 billion) and 2024 ($10 billion)

items.title: India's services exports boom offsets turbulence in goods trade: FinMin report
items.summary: India's services exports are providing a crucial buffer against merchandise trade volatility, growing by 9.7% year-on-year to reach $237.6 billion in April-October FY26. This robust performance has generated a net services surplus of $118.7 billion, helping to offset the overall trade deficit. Total exports saw a 4.8% YoY growth during the period.

items.title: Niche language films widen box office beyond native states with strong storytelling
items.summary: Regional films, particularly Malayalam and Gujarati, are achieving significant box office success with relatable, high-quality storytelling. Films like Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra and Gujarati hits have set new records, indicating a shift in audience preferences.

items.title: India’s stock market liquidity is spreading: Here’s how mid- and small-caps are driving the shift
items.summary: Market concentration across NSE is at multi-year lows, as liquidity and ownership spread beyond large-caps, led by mid- and small-cap stocks and supported by rising retail and institutional participation.

items.title: Multibagger defence stock Apollo Micro Systems raises its capital base by converting warrants into equities
items.summary: Apollo Micro Systems has expanded its capital by converting warrants into 1,21,47,964 equity shares for six investors. The company's paid-up equity capital now stands at  ₹35.43 crore after this conversion, with a total of 2,08,59,246 warrants converted so far.

items.title: Patel Engineering surges 13.66% on ₹798-crore coal project win
items.summary: The stock opened at ₹35.50 against the previous close of ₹33.17 and touched an intraday high of ₹38.60

items.title: Kaynes Technology’s stock slumps—but its $1 billion growth push is just beginning
items.summary: Despite a 25% slide, Kaynes is betting on massive capex, government-backed subsidies, and new capacities to fuel one of the fastest growth runways in India’s electronics manufacturing space.

items.title: Catamaran Ventures to follow patient capital route in bets on India's manufacturing push
items.summary: Family office Catamaran Ventures is increasing investments in growth-stage precision manufacturing betting on the supply chain. The firm seeks mid-market private equity opportunities in aerospace, EVs, and semiconductors with investment sizes from Rs50 crore to Rs500 crore for mature businesses.

items.title: KKR-backed Serentica may raise up to $8 bn for India green energy expansion
items.summary: Serentica Renewables plans to raise $6 billion to $8 billion over five years to more than double its clean energy capacity to 17 GW by 2029/30. The company, backed by KKR, is seeking opportunistic acquisitions and has $3 billion fully funded for its expansion. Separately, Resonia will invest $1.5 billion to $2.5 billion annually in India's transmission sector.

items.title: Paytm shares rise as RBI grants payment aggregator licence to subsidiary
items.summary: The stock movement follows an announcement that the Reserve Bank of India granted a Certificate of Authorization to Paytm to operate as a Payment Aggregator

items.title: Kearney expands its South India footprint with a new office in Chennai
items.summary: As TN continues to grow above 11% and widens its lead as India’s second-largest economy, we need to be closer to clients: Siddharth Jain, Managing Partner and Country Head, Kearney India

items.title: Whirlpool India shares plunge 11% as promoter offloads 7.5% stake
items.summary: The sharp decline followed a block deal announcement where promoter Whirlpool Mauritius will sell up to 95 lakh shares, representing 7.51% of the company’s equity

items.title: Tata Realty borrows Rs 1,280 cr from DBS Bank for Gurugram project
items.summary: Tata Realty and Infrastructure Ltd has secured a significant Rs 1,280 crore green loan from DBS Bank India. This funding is for a sustainable commercial project in Gurugram. DBS Bank India served as the sole advisor and green loan coordinator for this important transaction. The loan will support certified green assets meeting global sustainability benchmarks.

items.title: Tech startups’ new playbook: Buy scale instead of burning cash to build it
items.summary: UpGrad Education is pursuing the acquisition of Unacademy, while CarTrade Tech is close to acquiring CarDekho, highlighting a trend in India's digital economy towards consolidation. Tech firms increasingly favour M&amp;As for growth, improving margins and market share ahead of potential IPOs.

items.title: Markets ready to hit new highs; Largecaps, autos and jewellery to drive momentum: Amnish Aggarwal
items.summary: Markets are poised for new highs as strong Q3 demand, GST cuts and improved liquidity boost sentiment, says Prabhudas Lilladher’s Amnish Aggarwal. Largecaps are expected to lead the next rally, autos and jewellery remain bright spots, while Paytm’s regulatory approvals lift long-term sentiment. Aggarwal remains cautious on infrastructure, capital goods and global cyclicals amid slower capex trends.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 ease after record highs; midcaps, smallcaps and several sectoral indices in red
items.summary: Bajaj Finance, HUL, Shriram Finance, L&T and Bajaj Finserv led Nifty 50 gainers, while Eicher Motors, Eternal, ONGC, Adani Enterprises and Bajaj Auto were the biggest losers.

items.title: 12 smallcaps soar up to 180% in 3 months. Do you own any?
items.summary: Despite the small-cap index showing minimal movement, several individual small-cap stocks have delivered exceptional returns. Twelve names gained more than 50% in three months, with Indo Thai Securities soaring nearly 200%. These performances stand out against the Sensex’s steady rise, revealing strong pockets of momentum within the broader small-cap universe.

items.title: Mint Explainer | How Omnicom’s acquisition of IPG will change Indian advertising
items.summary: The biggest advertising industry deal has created the biggest media and advertising holding company in the world. How will it change things in India and the world at a time of deep turmoil for the legacy firms running advertising?&nbsp;

items.title: Nifty hovers near record high as banking stocks power rally
items.summary: While the Nifty Bank Nifty Financial Services index made gains, the Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 declined

items.title: Bank of Japan advocates 'measured' rate hikes to balance the economy
items.summary: BOJ board member Asahi Noguchi emphasised a measured, step-by-step approach to interest rate hikes to balance growth and inflation. Rapid increases risk slowing wages, while slow hikes may destabilise the economy. Policy will consider price stability, exchange rates, and asset prices, with the rate serving as a flexible tool.

items.title: India, UAE discuss market access, data sharing, FTA progress
items.summary: These issues were discussed during a meeting of the joint committee under India and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA)

items.title: Paytm arm PPSL gets RBI nod to operate as payment aggregator
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has granted a Certificate of Authorization to Paytm Payments Services Limited to operate as a Payment Aggregator under the Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007

items.title: Nifty 50 could touch 30,000 by 2026: JP Morgan
items.summary: Upgrade reflects sustained domestic strength, improving policy support and expectations of solid corporate earnings, the brokerage said

items.title: Double-digit surge expected across 2W, CV and PV segments in November 2025: Nuvama
items.summary: The report noted that November wholesales are likely to remain robust, with two-wheeler makers such as Hero MotoCorp, Eicher Motors’ Royal Enfield and TVS Motor Company expected to outperform peers

items.title: The biggest risk of leadership in the information age? Blindly trusting data and ignoring your gut
items.summary: Data may present the truth, but is it the whole truth? In a world overrun by data, remember what sets you apart. Sharpen your intuition, imagination and ability to read weak signals that digital systems can’t process. Leadership demands what AI can’t deliver.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty hit all-time high. But it's not a bull market yet
items.summary: Sensex and Nifty hit record highs, but nearly half of Nifty50 stocks remain below all-time peaks, highlighting a narrow rally led by a few largecaps. Retail investors are exiting secondary markets for IPOs, while analysts advise caution, selective buying, and tight risk management amid high valuations and market concentration.

items.title: SoftBank CDS Widens, Rakuten Narrows as Credit Views Diverge
items.summary: SoftBank Group Corp.’s credit-default swaps climbed to the highest level since April, as investors turned cautious on the tech behemoth’s debt-fueled growth at a time of intensifying global competition.

items.title: Hong Kong Fire Liability Triggers Drop at Taiping Insurance
items.summary: China Taiping Insurance Holdings Co. shares fell Thursday on concerns over the insurer’s estimated HK$2.6 billion ($334 million) exposure to a Hong Kong residential project at the center of a deadly fire.

items.title: No plan to hike vehicles' price from Jan; won't undermine GST rate cut initiative: Mahindra
items.summary: “We will take prices up only if there is a very visible and tangible increase in manufacturing cost; We will not announce a price increase just because that's the typical habit,"

items.title: Pro Fin Capital Services board approves 25% stake sale deal with Excellence Creative
items.summary: The company has not yet decided on deal closure timelines as the offer is non-binding in nature and no final decision has been taken on the transaction structure

items.title: HDFC Bank, Bajaj Finance lead as Nifty50 climbs to fresh record above 26,300
items.summary: The Nifty50 index reached a record high of 26,310.45. Strong buying in financial, IT, infrastructure, and consumption stocks fueled the rally.  Domestic institutional flows and sector-specific momentum supported the gains.  Bajaj Finance and Larsen & Toubro were among the top performers.  Despite some declines, the overall market sentiment remained positive.

items.title: Mahindra launches XEV 9S electric 7-seater SUV at ₹19.95 lakh
items.summary: The SUV comes with seven airbags, L2+ ADAS, a driver monitoring system and a 360-degree view system. It runs on an advanced LFP battery with a claimed real-world range of 500 km and a lifetime warranty

items.title: GMDC shares rise for third straight session, up 7% on government rare earth incentive
items.summary: Gujarat Mineral Development Corporation (GMDC) shares surged 7% for a third consecutive day following a Rs 7,280-crore government incentive scheme to boost domestic production of critical minerals. This initiative aims to reduce reliance on China and create significant production capacity for rare earth magnets, benefiting companies like GMDC.

items.title: Natco Pharma shares drop over 5% after previous day’s double-digit gains
items.summary: Natco Pharma shares fell as investors booked profits after a sharp rally in the previous session. The stock has been volatile this week, slipping earlier after the US FDA issued seven Form-483 observations at its Manali API plant, which the company said were manageable.

items.title: Valuations not stretched, earnings will drive rally ahead: Dinshaw Irani
items.summary: Seasoned voices like Dinshaw Irani expressed unwavering confidence in the market's trajectory, anticipating new highs this year. He dismissed valuation concerns, highlighting strong earnings growth across market caps as the primary driver. Irani is particularly excited about smallcaps, seeing significant potential for growth once foreign investors rejoin the rally.

items.title: Can private actions alleviate extreme poverty in India? Every little bit you do could eventually help
items.summary: Many wonder what they can do to improve the conditions of those living in abject poverty in India. Everyone can contribute, from business leaders and researchers to teachers and journalists. Though their efforts may seem weakly linked with visible outcomes, they could work wonders over time.

items.title: IREDA's 632% vertical takeoff to 42% slide in just 50 sessions, PSU stock gives a reality check. Buy, hold or exit?
items.summary: IREDA shares have witnessed volaityly in the recent past,  surging 632% in 13 months before tumbling 42% in just 50 sessions. Despite strong Q2FY26 earnings and long-term growth potential, analysts warn of ongoing bearish momentum, margin pressures, and sectoral headwinds. Investors are advised to hold near support levels of Rs 137–140.

items.title: Rupee falls 2 paise to 89.24 against U.S. dollar in early trade
items.summary: The rupee declined due to increased demand of dollars from importers amid volatile global trade

items.title: RBI, SEBI in talks to review curbs on FX derivatives as volumes shift offshore
items.summary: Regulators consider tweaks to stringent norms governing exchange-traded currency derivatives in a potential effort to revive a market increasingly shifting offshore

items.title: Kevin Hassett tipped as next Fed Chair, markets eye dollar impact
Patel Engineering gets ₹800-cr work order in Chhattisgarh
items.summary: The company has received letter of intents from Saidax Engineers and Infrastructures

items.title: Mint Explainer | How proposed amendments to India's arbitration regime can resolve disputes faster
items.summary: Faster dispute resolution and clearer timelines are positive indicators for investments because it means contracts will be enforced quicker and more decisively.

items.title: RBI & Sebi n talks to review curbs on currency derivatives: Reports
items.summary: Indian regulators are considering easing strict rules on currency derivatives after a significant market shift offshore. The Reserve Bank of India's 2024 enforcement of requiring underlying exposures for derivative positions led to a sharp decline in domestic trading, while overseas markets saw a surge. Discussions are underway to potentially revive the market for individual traders with new safeguards.

items.title: India's Vodafone Idea unit cuts debt issue size, aims for December completion, sources say
items.summary: Vodafone Idea Telecom Infrastructure is reducing its bond sale to 32 billion rupees. The company seeks cheaper funding from lenders. It plans to raise debt through two-year and three-year bonds. The funds will support expansion. The company expects to secure cheaper bank funding in 2026. This follows a Supreme Court order on adjusted gross revenue dues.

items.title: India’s valuation reset could attract FIIs back: Manishi Raychaudhuri
items.summary: Indian markets have hit a new record high. Investors are now looking ahead to future opportunities. Earnings strength and visibility are key factors for investment decisions. A turnaround in earnings is expected from early 2026. This will be supported by government priorities and potential RBI rate cuts. Select sectors show earnings improvement. Large banks are catching up.

items.title: India-UAE advance discussions on market access, data exchange and FTA roadmap
items.summary: India and the UAE held discussions on market access, data sharing, gold import quotas, and anti-dumping as part of the Joint Committee meeting under their CEPA. Both nations reviewed progress and explored ways to boost economic ties, including enhancing regulatory cooperation and signing MoUs on food safety.

items.title: Japan to boost shorter debt to fund stimulus plan; Fitch warns on rating
items.summary: Japan plans to boost short- and medium-term bond issuance to fund a massive 21.3 trillion yen stimulus package. This move comes amid concerns over rising super-long yields and potential risks to the nation's "A" sovereign debt rating, as highlighted by Fitch Ratings. The government will increase scheduled JGB sales, focusing on two- and five-year maturities.

items.title: Glenmark's Monroe facility classified as voluntary action indicated by USFDA

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 26th November 2025: Sensex jumps 1,022.50 points; Nifty inches near record high on US fed rate cut hopes
items.summary:
Snapping the three-day falling streak, benchmark Sensex rebounded by 1,022 points while Nifty reclaimed the 26,000 level on Wednesday on across-the-board buying aided by a rally in global peers amid growing hopes of a US Fed rate cut and fresh foreign fund inflows.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 1,022.50 points or 1.21 per cent to settle at 85,609.51. During the day, it surged 1,057.18 points or 1.24 per cent to 85,644.19.

The 50-share NSE Nifty zoomed 320.50 points or 1.24 per cent to end at 26,205.30, just 10 points shy of its all time high.

In intra-day trade, Nifty rallied 330.35 points

items.title: EPFO sets up panel for cadre restructuring
items.summary: To address the current challenges within its organizational setup, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has assembled a four-member committee, under the guidance of BP Sharma. This committee will evaluate the existing employee structure, uncover operational inefficiencies, and put forth suggestions to elevate both efficiency and customer service. Furthermore, the panel will explore frameworks for the reassignment of officers and staff.

items.title: ADB approves $400 million for climate-resilient roads in Maharashtra
items.summary: The Asian Development Bank has approved a $400 million results-based lending program for Maharashtra to develop climate-resilient, low-carbon, and safe road networks. This initiative will expand all-weather roads in 34 districts, particularly in vulnerable regions, connecting rural communities to essential services and markets. The program also emphasizes road safety, climate resilience, and gender equality, benefiting over 1.7 million people.

items.title: Finance ministry tells banks to fast-track IBC cases, CEOs asked to personally monitor top pending resolutions

items.title: Sitharaman pushes for streamlined corporate governance, directs MCA to build real-time transparency dashboard
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized simplifying processes and making systems user-friendly for easy and transparent governance. She directed the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) to modernize systems for timely stakeholder service and build a live dashboard for enhanced transparency. Discussions covered various operational aspects to improve ease of doing business.

items.title: As anti-Maoist push nears final phase, Chhattisgarh shifts Bastar strategy to tourism and small industries

With declining Maoist violence and improved connectivity, the region is attracting significant investment, aiming for a turnaround through sustainable development and hospitality projects.

items.title: Centre halts fresh Jal Jeevan Mission funds until states act on widespread corruption findings

Following a high-level review and deployment of nodal officers, action has been taken against hundreds of officials and contractors, with FIRs lodged in several states. A scheme-based funding model will replace lump sums to ensure accountability.

Anticipation builds as the government prepares to unveil feedback mechanisms soon. This overhaul is strategically aimed at stimulating investments and job creation. Additionally, fixed-term employment is now safeguarded, offering vital protections.

This surplus capacity can help reduce imports from countries like ASEAN and China.

The Rs 25,060 crore Export Promotion Mission aims to strengthen outbound shipments, with detailed guidelines for the Interest Equalisation Scheme and the Market Access Initiative expected shortly. items.title: The week in charts: Trade trends, unemployment rate, rural demand, and more
items.summary: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on Saturday, November 22? Check here

items.title: Cabinet approval for  ₹7,300 crore rare earth magnet scheme expected within a month

items.title: Diagnostic chains weigh in as weight-loss drugs take off in India

items.title: India tells WTO its farm import quotas went unused due to weak demand
items.summary: India informed the WTO that it hasn't blocked imports of certain agricultural products. The unutilized quota for these goods indicates that market conditions, not protective measures, drive import patterns, with domestic production satisfying demand.

items.summary: Industry bodies also said measures such as single registration, single licence and single return for employers, along with an inspector-cum-facilitator system instead of strict enforcement, would make it easier to do business.

items.summary: The International Maritime Organization (IMO), routinely lays down rules that regulate international shipping which carries almost all of the world’s trade. These rules are a result of consensus arrived at carefully, with much expert input, through meetings that are not dramatic. But in October, when the IMO that has 176 member-nations met to vote on decarbonising global shipping as a response to climate change, the U.S. actively disrupted the meeting. Chaos ruled. Threats were made. Arms were twisted. And the vote on a decarbonization programme that India helped to draft was deferred by a yea

items.summary: U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures fell 20 cents, or 0.5%, to $37.85 a barrel at 0056 GMT, after climbing 3.5% on Wednesday.

items.title: US EIA cuts 2020 world oil demand growth forecast
items.summary: In its monthly forecast, the agency cut its oil demand growth estimate for 2021 by 490,000 bpd to 6.53 million bpd.

items.title: Gold may remain choppy, but buying may emerge at lower levels: Kotak Securities
items.summary: Gold may remain choppy but buying may emerge at lower levels amid increasing global uncertainty and also as Fed’s dovish stance may limit upside in US dollar.

items.title: Oil breaks below $40/bbl on demand concerns, improving supply
items.summary: Fed#39;s dovish stance may also limit any major upside in the US dollar.

items.title: Agri Picks Report: Geojit
items.summary: According to Geojit, Global consumption of edible oils is expected to fall 30-40% in 2020 because of coronavirus lockdowns, said Dominic Xavier, Middle East and North Africa region head at Sime Darby Oils.

items.title: Oil falls further amid growing alarm over coronavirus second wave
items.summary: The biggest global health crisis in a century continues to flare unabated with cases rising in India, Great Britain, Spain and several parts of the United States, where the infection rate has not come under control for months.

items.title: Gold flat as dollar strength counters safe-haven demand

items.title: Gold may witness choppy trade, expect buying at lower levels: Kotak Securities

items.title: Energy Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Oil prices hit a rough patch last week, falling back in line with broader financial markets. Prices did try to inch higher, but experienced selling pressure at highs.

items.title: Precious Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Gold fell to the lowest level in a month primarily as the dollar rose against its major crosses and better-than-expected economic number from the US.

items.title: Base Metals Weekly Report: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: According to Motilal Oswal, Base metals traded choppy last week, with prices hitting multi month highs at the start of the week and followed by some profit taking on back of volatility in the dollar and mixed data signals from China and US.

items.title: Flipkart records highest-ever single day sale, grosses $200mn
items.summary: This is the biggest ever single day sale for Bangalore-based Flipkart, since the time the company started in 2007.

items.title: Subramanian Swamy seeks ban on import of cement from Pakistan
items.summary: "Allowing imports of cement from Pakistan, therefore, carried with it the additional risk in that it provides an effective cover for smuggling of contraband goods and harmful weapons and ammunition concealed in cement bags which comes in rakes and trucks, in the hands of disruptionist elements," he said.

items.title: Moneycontrol Exclusive: Govt plans overhaul of tax administration for smooth GST rollout
items.summary: The government has readied plans for a major change in India’s tax administration structure, including overhauling the Central Board of Excise and Customs (CBEC) to ensure a glitch-free roll-out of a nation-wide goods and services tax (GST).

items.title: Sensex, Nifty wobbly; Hind Zinc, SBI, Force Motors most active
items.summary: Asian Paints, SBI, Tata Motors, HUL and Maruti Suzuki are top gainers while ONGC, Axis Bank, MM, Bajaj Auto and Hero MotoCorp are major losers in the Sensex.

items.title: Uber  redBus partner with ixigo for train travellers
items.summary: ixigo, India’s leading mobile travel marketplace has announced partnerships with Uber and redBus to enable instant bookings for cabs and buses natively within ixigo trains app.

items.title: Workload in IT to come down due to AI; jobs to reduce: Genpact
items.summary: But along with that the employment growth rates have started to dip, NV 'Tiger' Tyagarajan says. The percentage addition of employees in India will not be same as past. And due to advancements, a workforce with higher skill sets is required for the IT industry, he says.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
